trans-unit.source: Represents a statement that attaches an event-handler delegate to an event.
<xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttachEventStatement> can be used to represent a statement that adds an event-handler delegate for an event.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttachEventStatement.Event%2A> property indicates the event to attach the event handler to.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttachEventStatement.Listener%2A> property indicates the event handler to attach.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeAttachEventStatement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeAttachEventStatement"></xref> class using the specified event and delegate.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeEventReferenceExpression"></xref> that indicates the event to attach an event handler to.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the new event handler.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeAttachEventStatement"></xref> class using the specified object containing the event, event name, and event-handler delegate.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the object that contains the event.
The name of the event to attach an event handler to.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the new event handler.
Gets or sets the event to attach an event-handler delegate to.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeEventReferenceExpression"></xref> that indicates the event to attach an event handler to.
Gets or sets the new event-handler delegate to attach to the event.
A <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> that indicates the new event handler to attach.
